basics.name: Eugene Yamenko
basics.label: Technical Lead
basics.summary: Expertise in backend, frontend, and cloud technologies, with strong communication and mentoring skills. Experience in designing and building complex, large-scale data-driven systems. Knowledge of best practices across the full software development life cycle.

highlights: Technical Lead for Amazon Redshift’s cross-region snapshot copy component (3 petabytes of copied snapshots/day) and credential vending service (200 million vended credentials/day).
Reduced maximum cross-region snapshot copy processing time by 74% and maximum bandwidth consumption by 52%.
Increased availability for the credential vending service to 99.99% and reduced latency by up to 93%.
Implemented shared instance tenancy support for capacity warmpools, improving capacity availability by up to 22 times.
Technical Lead for Domain’s property listing backend services (7 thousand listing updates/minute and 25 thousand retrieved listings/minute).
Improved performance by 48% for an on-demand imaging service (11 thousand processed images/minute) by modernizing it and switching to an image engine optimized for the used processor architecture.
Reduced average response time by 23% for a listing retrieval service by eliminating file system buffering for large response objects.
Created a technology strategy along with an audit of the existing solutions.
Reduced cached data size by 72% by storing data in a compressed binary serialization format, leading to improved network latency, lower bandwidth usage, and more cached data.
Built an API backend and worker services for the off-market properties product.
Reduced service operational costs by 60% by modernizing and containerizing 18 services and utilizing a scalable container management platform.
Built a frontend application to manage listings in migration between listing providers.
Introduced and adopted infrastructure as code tools; and created a library for deploying load-balanced, worker, and scheduled services.
Built a frontend application to manage related development projects.
Split InfoTrack’s main monolithic e-conveyancing service into regional microservices.
Contributed to the architectural group, providing expertise in software design and architecture.
Built a frontend application for ClickView’s video learning resource platform to store and manage customer-uploaded videos.
Implemented a custom integration with Salesforce.
Built a service to send out and track promotional and recommendation emails.
Organized and regularly presented at the monthly internal knowledge-sharing events.
